page.title: 10Energy
page.content:
{Drax Power Station }
Camblesforth County Primary School Classes One and Two were shown round Drax Power Station by some of the men that work there. We were shown around the construction site and the station itself. The Power Station uses coal from the Selby Coal Field. The coal is brought by train to the coal plant. It drops from the waggons through the track to a conveyor belt on which it is taken into the station. There are about three trains an hour. The coal is powdered and fed into the boilers. The powder is burnt to heat the water, and the steam this produces turns the turbines which generate the electricity.
